page.title: 10Fishing At Bowden Springs
page.content: Bowden Springs Fishery, which is situated in the Bathgate Hills between Linlithgow and Torphichen, has been open between 2 and 3 years. The land covers eleven acres, and the ponds are stocked twice a week with 200-1000 fish at a time. Any fisherman can fish here, for a fee, either for the morning, a day or an evening. The busiest time is from June-July. The heaviest fish anybody has caught was 8lbs. When fishing the catch is limited to 5 fish in winter and 4 in summer. Over 2500 trees and shrubs have been planted for shelter and to make the place more attractive. Beech is the most common with oak, ash, birch, crabapple, willow, dogwood and alder also being planted. Hedges of hawthorn, blackthorn and dogrose have also been put in.
